page.title: 13RELIGION AND CHURCHES
page.content:
The oldest church in Great Ayton is All Saints Church, built in the 12th century. It had a spire that collapsed then a tower which was demolished in 178O. Most of the stained glass was destroyed in the Reformation and replaced in the 19th century. The oldest object in the church is the 6th century Saxon crucifix. A gravestone marks where most of James Cook's family are buried. Flutings on the porch walls were reputedly made by warriors sharpening spears. The Catholics, who obviously once owned this church, now have a modern brick church behind the Buck Hotel.
The churches run Youth Clubs and the church hall is used for village functions, lectures, jumble sales etc.
